derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French eschine, based on a blend of Latin spina 'spine' and a Germanic word meaning 'narrow piece', related to shin
Old English cinu 'cleft, chink', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch keen, also to chink
late Middle English: variant of chime (the original sense)

means.word_mean: 1. cut of meat or fish including at least part of the backbone
1. cut through the backbone of an animal
